channel.title: Git on GeekJoe
channel.description: Recent content in Git on GeekJoe

item.title: Commit messages guide
item.description:
A guide to understanding the importance of commit messages and how to write them well.

It may help you to learn what a commit is, why it is important to write good messages, best practices and some tips to plan and (re)write a good commit history.

item.title: WebHook Based on Git(Using PHP)
item.description: 使用Webhook实现远程服务器自动拉取更新内容

item.title: TortoiseGit on windows tutorial
item.description:
Description

Tutorial of TortoiseGit on Windows.

TortoiseGit is a Git revision control client, implemented as a Windows shell extension and based on TortoiseSVN. It is free software released under the GNU General Public License.

In Windows Explorer, besides showing context menu items for Git commands, TortoiseGit provides icon overlays that indicate the status of Git working trees and files.

It also comes with the TortoiseGitMerge utility to visually compare two files and resolve conflicts.
